MS MCQs

    Build an Azure Digital Twins graph for a chocolate factory production line

    »

    1. What are the fields of a Digital Twins Definition Language (DTDL) interface?

      @type, name, schema

      Property, Telemetry, Component, Relationship

      @id, @type, @context, displayName, contents

      primitive types, and Object, Map, Enum


    2. What is the difference between a DTDL property and DTDL telemetry?

      There is no significant difference.

      Properties are expected to have storage, that can be written to if necessary. Telemetry is a stream of values.

      Properties do not change, Telemetry changes continuously.

      Telemetry is for IoT devices, Properties are for digital twins.


    3. You have a set of models, some of which contain a property called Temperature. Which of the following queries return all models with a temperature less than 65 degrees?

      SELECT * FROM DigitalTwins T WHERE T.Temp < 65

      SELECT * FROM DigitalTwins T WHERE T.Temperature < 65

      SELECT * FROM DigitalTwins WHERE IS_DEFINED(Temperature)

      if (Temperature < 65) return model.name;


    4. What is a distinction between a FROM clause in a SQL-type language and a FROM clause in the Azure Digital Twins query language?

      In the ADT query language, you can only have one JOIN statement in the FROM clause, while in a SQL-type language, you can have multiple.

      In the ADT query language, each expression in a FROM clause is not a table. Instead, the FROM clause expresses a cross-entity relationship traversal, and is written with an Azure Digital Twins version of JOIN.

      In the ADT query language, the FROM clause is used to specify which table to select data from, while in a SQL-type language, each expression in a FROM clause expresses a cross-entity relationship traversal.
